briefTitle: A Primary Care Behavioral Approach for Addressing Childhood Overweight
officialTitle: Evaluation of a Primary Care-Based Behavioral Intervention for Improving Physical Activity and Nutrition Behaviors Among High-Risk African-American Youth
summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether participation in a group-based health education curriculum is superior to receipt of standardized health educational materials for children who are overweight or at risk for overweight with regard to achievement of a healthier body weight and improvement of key eating and physical activity behaviors.
